headline: Eggplant Lasagna
description: This eggplant lasagna recipe layers slices of eggplant with seasoned ground beef for a delicious Italian dinner that can easily be made vegetarian.

video.description: Layers of breaded roasted eggplant with ground beef, tomato sauce, and cheese.
video.name: Eggplant Lasagna

name: Eggplant Lasagna
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 large eggplants, peeled and sliced into 1/2-inch rounds
48 ounces chunky tomato sauce (such as Prego®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 2 baking sheets and a 9x13-inch baking dish with 1 teaspoon olive oil.
Whisk together eggs and water in a shallow dish. Combine Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, salt, and pepper in a separate shallow dish.
Dip eggplant slices into egg mixture, then press into bread crumb mixture. Gently tap off any excess crumbs. Arrange breaded eggplant slices on the prepared baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until the bottoms are golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. Flip eggplant and continue baking until tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Set aside.
Increase the oven temperature to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in ground beef; season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes. Drain excess grease. Stir tomato sauce into ground beef; bring to a simmer, then set sauce aside.

Place 1/3 of the eggplant slices on the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Pour 1/3 of the meat sauce on top of eggplant layer. Sprinkle 1/3 of the mozzarella cheese on top of sauce layer. Repeat this step 2 more times, finishing with a layer of mozzarella cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbling, 10 to 15 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes before slicing.

review.reviewBody: My kids, who hate vegetables, ate EVERYTHING! Will definitely make this again. Only change I would make is add some garlic to the recipe.

Have made this multiple times for guests and everyone is a fan! I make it ahead and pop it in the oven during happy hour. Takes about 30 minutes. Always add extra mozzarella, use 32 ounce jar and two cans of diced tomatoes.

The best eggplant lasagna I have ever had. The way the eggplant is cooked prior to doing the layers makes it perfect, not soggy but crisp!! My husband loved it! Definitely making it again and again. Next time I will cut down the recipe bc it is very filling and next day leftovers are not as good, the eggplant gets soggy.
I used sweet Italian sausage

I had half a large eggplant left over from another recipe a couple of days ago and decided to try this one with the rest. I used approximately half the amounts listed in the recipe for the other ingredients. It made plenty for two senior small eaters plus a smaller serving which I'll have for tomorrow's lunch. In the twelve years we have been together, this is the first time I've received what might be construed as something of a compliment on my cooking from my domestic partner. He said, "You'll want to save that recipe." LOL. I'm quite fond of eggplant, so no doubt I'll make it again. Tasty.
This really was delicious and I did not miss the pasta at all. I added onions to the ground beef and sauteed. Also topped it with feta cheese as I did not have enough mozzarella on hand.

I loved it however my husband suggested using mild Italian sausage and we use Newman's Own Marinara sauce as well. I have this recipe saved on my computer and I really appreciate you putting it on All Recipes!!
A very flexible recipe. I only had 36 oz jar of sauce and it wasn't chunky so I added tomato, onion, garlic and had 1.5# beef. turned out great.

Great Italian casserole for eggplant lovers who favor an Italian entree with more protein , less carbs and less fat. I had about 10 ounces of low fat ricotta I needed to use up, so I inserted a thin ricotta layer. Made my own rich marinara with canned tomatoes, tomato paste, sautéed onions, garlic, olives, herbs, chili flakes, a little red wine. Other than that, I followed the recipe and it was great. Family loved it! Leftovers in freezer for easy weeknight meal!

I took a few liberties with this recipe by making a meat sauce with ground chicken and used a low-fat ricotta and cottage cheese mix with parmesan to layer between the pieces of eggplant. It turned out absolutely amazing! The eggplant was still crispy even under the meat sauce and cheese layers. If you are looking for a new dish to add to your rotation you won't be disappointed.
I made one change tot the recipe and added a little cayenne pepper in the sauce - yummy! I will be making this again!
This came out absolutely delicious and my family all went back for seconds even third portions delicious

I made quite a few modifications to this, based on what I had available and not being a meat eater. I prepped the eggplant as in the recipe, but used the grated parmigiana between layers, instead of in the breading mixture. I made the red sauce with onion, orange bell pepper, mushrooms, garlic and diced tomatoes and let it simmer while the eggplant was baking. I ended up baking the eggplant probably an extra 20 mins to get a better color. I also made about a cup and a half of béchamel sauce, as I didn’t have any mozzarella and only some Monterey Jack cheese mixture. I know, totally changed the recipe, really, but it turned out really delicious! I layered everything and finished with the béchamel sauce and the cheese I had. It was a hit!
It was very easy and very good !
Worth a second helping.

I cooked a medium onion and 2T minced garlic in olive oil before adding ground turkey. I also used twice as much shredded mozzarella as the recipe states. Next time, I will triple the cheese and add mushrooms.
Excellent!!!! Will make again.
This is my ultimate favorite recipe. I make my own homemade meat sauce so I use that but breast and baking the eggplant makes it so good.
One of my families new favorites!
Great! One addition i did was put flour on the eggplant slices before the egg dip so the eggs don't slip right off!
This eggplant lasagna is some of the best I've tasted. Even from restaurants. I did add ricotta cheese between the layers with also more parmesan . I had three layers of pure excellence.
Very easy, everyone loved it!
It was great! What else you need to know.

I was cooking just for me and wanted to try this. I used some leftover meat sauce I had frozen and also only had one eggplant but it gave me enough for leftovers for lunch. It was easy to do and while everything was in the oven baking, I was able to do other thing. I probably used more cheese that was called for but more cheese is always good. I plan to make this again.

Very easy recipe to make. My partner is a Type II diabetic, and he loves this dish. It's so good that he doesn't miss the pasta at all. He even asked for this dish for his birthday dinner. :)
I did do some tweaking. I added 1/3 cup of part-skim ricotta cheese mixed with chopped steamed spinach to each layer between the eggplant and the meat sauce. I also prefer to use plain breadcrumbs with my own Italian spices added. Also, I like using hot Italian-style ground turkey instead of beef to give it a bit more kick and to cut back on the fat.
Excellent! Didn't change a thing!

Baking the eggplant in oven while making meat sauce was great! The technique gave the eggplant a nice crunch while keeping it cooked well but not mushy. I did change up cheese... made a cheese sauce instead of just mozzarella and added mushrooms to meat sauce. Was very awesome however it is known to my husband as Mousaka he even liked it. Lol he usually doesn’t.
Excellent dish. I love eggplant and the initial steps makes this dish rewarding by baking the eggplant ahead

Great! I used a mandoline to thinly slice the eggplant longwise and threw the slices on the grill. I got several layers out of one eggplant, no problem. I also layered in some cooked Italian sausage. A little messy to try to cut squares, but still delicious!
I've made this twice (though with ground turkey) and both times it was a hit, even with people who normally dislike eggplant!

This recipe is delicious! I used a combination of hot and sweet Italian sausage instead if ground beef. I also used jarred marinara sauce which I doctored up with oregano, basil and fennel seed (ground).
Yes I made this and I can say that it was excellent absolutely excellent
Yes I made this and I can say that it was excellent absolutely excellent

I have made this recipe 5 times now and it is always perfect! I did have to changed one ingredient because my daughter is allergic to eggs. Replaced eggs with heavy whipping cream for dipping the eggplant. Turned out perfectly!
This is one of my favorite AllRecipes!
It was delicious. Loved it, especially since no pasta was used! Trying to watch weight and diabetes.

This eggplant lasagna was very good and they even loved the eggplant inside - that they didn't know was in there! It was a lot of work considering the breading and frying of the eggplant and then having to construct the dish, but it was worth it.
I used real mozzarella chunks on top.

SO great! I had a weird craving for eggplant, and I remembered my grandfather making eggplant lasagna for my diabetic mom when I was a kid. This brought back great memories. I used ground turkey, because Corona and quarantine and that was what I already had in the freezer. I don't think it harmed the flavor at all. I also only had one eggplant, so I tried halving the recipe, but ended up using as much sauce as it called for, and used ricotta as the middle cheese, because what is lasagna without ricotta?? My husband, a big carnivore, was hugely impressed, and even tried to have it for breakfast in the morning. Overall, this is a great recipe.
This was my first attempt and it was fun to make and delicious!!!!
It turned out wonderful!!! Will definitely keep this recipe. The only addition I did was to add fresh mushrooms to the meat sauce.. Nice hit with my family....
time consuming but worth it
A great alternative to traditional pasta dish. Its even great reheated covered in the oven.

Amazing!! Added ricotta, egg and milk to the cheese. It was really good! Definitely agree that its all about the prep of the eggplant! My husband swears he does not like eggplant, but could not stop eating this!
Love this recipe! I made it with turkey Italian sausage, onion, green pepper and mushrooms to add more vegetables.

Egg plant turned out very crispy which worked well as it absorbed liquid from the sauce. It didn't become soggy. I did add ricotta and mozzarella mixture and used chicken as the protein. Lots of great tastes. Will make again!
I did add some sprinkles of Romano on top before baking for a bit of extra flavor otherwise ,no changes, followed recipe and it was very easy and delicious.
Added mushrooms and onions.
I lived in Northern Italy for 2 years, and there was a restaurant by my apartment that made eggplant lasagna. I've spent years trying to find a similar recipe, and this is it!
Turn out awesome!! My husband loved it!! I just cut the eggplant the long cut. Used a smaller pan since it was just for two.

We all really enjoyed this. I did add extra meat, and ricotta cheese but otherwise I followed all the recipe. I found it took a long time to make....too long to make part of our regular rotation, but it was very good!

This is a wonderful recipe for eggplant. The way it’s baked makes it delicious! I followed the recipe but added fresh chopped basil between the layers and sprinkled the left over crumbs on the top. Oh and used Italian sausage instead of ground beef! So flavorful! My new favor!!
Absolutely delicious! A real wow with the family! I must admit to adding ricotta cheese to the top layer and then covered with shredded mozzarella and a tad of Parmesan. Sooo yummy!!!

A wonderful recipe. I made in a large 9-inch square casserole using 2 medium eggplants and Italian sausage instead of the ground beef. I baked the eggplant slices on silpat which worked great. I also used fresh Mozzarella cheese slices and only made two layers. Would definitely make again. I would have added fresh basil if I had it available.

I love eggplant and I make a variety of casseroles with it. This dish was tasty and pretty easy to make. But I had a problem with the amount of the ingredients! The 2 large eggplants weren't enough to make even 2 layers in a 9x13 pan. I had to switch to a 7x11 pan and even then I was only able to make 2 layers. Because of that I had too much meat sauce leftover and less cheese was needed. If I make this again, I would either keep the eggplant amount the same , using smaller pan and cut down the pasta sauce and the cheese, or add another large eggplant, with more breading ingredients.
This was an amazing low-carb alternative. I followed the recipe exactly, with the exception of adding a ricotta/basil/parmesan mixture between layers. So yummy!
Amazing! I added onion and fresh garlic When browning the ground beef and Parmesan cheese with the mozzarella cheese layers, otherwise would not change a thing.

I made this sans meat, threw in some cabbage leaves and cottage cheese and loved it! I had leftover Parmesan cheese and breadcrumb mix, which I simply threw on top of the uppermost layer of mozzarella cheese - which turned out wonderfully crusty! Will definitely make again!

We were given an eggplant, but didn't know what to do with it. My husband had never had eggplant. I made is according to directions, and he LOVED it! Next time I will make it more like a traditional lasagna, having an egg and cottage cheese layer.
I made it and I thought that it was delicious.
I just tweeted it a little. Used ricotta provolone. And mozzarella cheese. No meat. Pomadoro sauce.
Added ground turkey and made a cheese mixture with ricotta cheese (like regular lasagna). Family loved it. Exceeded expectations!
Great recipe! I used ground turkey, onions, chives, green onion and various seasoning. My favourite lasagne recipe by far. Everyone loved it!
WOW ! I made it with gluten free bread crumbs. dairy and soy free mozzarella. I used Italian sausage with a clove of garlic and organic jar sauce. DELISH !

First time ever trying eggplant lasagna and I loved it. The only thing I changed was I used ground turkey instead of beef and added ricotta cheese. Easy recipe to follow and make definitely will be making more.
I liked it a lot and will add it to my list of recipes to improvise. In fact, I made a number of changes, so I'll do it again following the recipe more closely!
I liked it a lot and will add it to my list of recipes to improvise. In fact, I made a number of changes, so I'll do it again following the recipe more closely!

I took advice from some that posted - cut eggplant lengthwise and also used mushrooms instead of meat as my daughter is a vegetarian. I also used a ricotta/cottage cheese, mozzarella, egg, parmesan cheese mixture as a layer. My daughter spruced up the spaghetti sauce by adding some cooked garlic, onion & carrots with the mushrooms. This meal was delicious!

This was very good! I did adjust to make it gluten free. I used almond flour instead of regular flour. I also added ricotta, frozen spinach thawed (squeezed of moisture). I also added onion and garlic powder to the meat while it cooked. I also cut the eggplant into strips rather than rounds and used three eggplants instead of two so it made a larger amount. Everyone loved it!
Soooo good!

I don’t do reviews very often but this was absolutely worth it! I added thin slices of zucchini and did the same thing to it as the eggplant and added in Italian dried herbs to the bread. Dumb mixture and sautés garlic and onions in the pan before adding the beef. Cooked everything the same as directed. So yummmmmy!! Thank you

This recipe has become one of our staples. I love making a pan of this lasagna for my husband and I. We always have plenty for leftovers, and it's delicious reheated in the oven! I am gluten-free, so I just substitute gluten free Panko for the seasoned breadcrumbs.
Add more spices.
Made it for my family. My picky husband and son loved this more then regular lasagna!
Very delicious i will make it again and again.
Really good first time i made it and it was a hit. Ofcourse i used twice as much cheese and used ground Turkey instead of beef.
It's delicious. I added a layer of Ricotta Cheese, otherwise I kept to the recipe. Everyone enjoyed it and had seconds! Good with a nice spinach salad on the side.
This was really good, I could of just ate the eggplants by themself as chips after getting them out of the oven. Also i used ricotta cheese for the middle layer of cheese, yum yum, ate way too much!
This was really good, I could of just ate the eggplants by themself as chips after getting them out of the oven. Also i used ricotta cheese for the middle layer of cheese, yum yum, ate way too much!
great recipe with great direction and video,i added portebello mushrooms to second layer for some extra POW.

This was the best lasagna I have ever made, and the first time using eggplant! I added some garlic and onions to my sauce but followed the directions otherwise. I like the big, thick chuncks of eggplant.

I made a substitute for the ground beef for mushrooms and followed the recipe exactly as it says. my wife loved it and my sixteen-year-old and we all know teenagers can be very finicky eaters and she loved it
Fresh eggplant from my husband's garden. He said make this again. Followed recipe.
Next time I will add more HB meat. But it was delicious and will definitely make again.
Made this on a whim and next time I’ll take the time to pre-plan and prep everything. Looks good. Now for the taste test.

I added chicken sausage and garlic to the tomatoe sauce for one of the casseroles. I left one without meat. 
I didn’t have mozzarella cheese and substituted provolone and a cheddar mix. My vegetarian and meat eating members really liked the meal.
This is my partner’s favorite meal now. Very tasty and flavorful.
Absolutely;y great. I used Presidents Choice Marinara sauce and it was just amazing meal

Used my own spaghetti meat sauce and eliminated bread crumbs. Used more parmesan. Eggplant was delicious all by itself after roasting. Layered a half cup of Alfredo with the mozzarella. 
Keto frIendly and wonderful. Thanks.

I recently had this dish at a local Italian restaurant and was in search for a recipe to replicate at home. 

This was absolutely delicious! I made a few modifications. 

1. Cut it lengthwise and didn’t peel the eggplant. Used the ends with the peels for the bottom layer—peel side down.

2. After browning ground beef added 1 clove of fresh, minced garlic and fresh mushrooms and simmered on low until mushrooms cooked through. 

3. In between each layer, I added ricotta cheese (gotta have ricotta)—saved motzerella cheese for the top layer only. 

Delicious!
This was very good! we used veggie meatballs instead of ground beef, and stuck it under the broiler for 2 minutes at the end to crisp up the cheese. yum!
very good. the only change i made was that i didn't use bottled sauce, but made my own.
Awesome!!'m
Great texture and flavor.
Followed the directions exactly and my whole family loved it.

This was sooo good. I added onions and garlic and my own homemade meat sauce. The flavor is exceptional. Baking the eggplant first is a must. Watch it so it doesn’t burn. I baked at 375 degrees then flipped after 20 min. This recipe is a keeper thanks!

This was brilliant! The key is def the eggplant treatment per another reviewer. I once made lasagna with slices of raw eggplant and then tried to cook the whole thing to death. I distinctly remember the eggplant being tough as shoe leather and the whole dish was not cohesive and just a major fail. The roasted and breaded eggplant takes on a natural and pleasant sweetness and the texture was fantastic. The breadcrumbs also helped to bind the dish together nicely. Per my personal tastes and what I had in the cupboard, I used panko. Also added my 3-cheese filling of ricotta, lg curd cottage and mozzarella cheeses, egg seasoning and garlic. I also used Rao marinara to reduce sugar and added about 6 oz of ground pork sausage to my meat mixture for some added pizazz. There’s a lot of room for experiment and adjustment to personal taste. I made a big enough pan to eat off all week, however the family went back for seconds and thirds, lol. Huge win and has me wanting to try other eggplant dishes now that I know the “trick”.
Much flavor but the measurements were off

I added a few garlic cloves to the sauce and added a pound of ground sausage to it. I sauteed some zucchini and put it in the layers of eggplant and I added extra cheese. in the end i probably came close to doubling it. 

It was amazing. will make exactly the same way again.
AMAZING
